main_definition: To free or remove from a burden, annoyance, or problem.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make someone feel happy and relieved of an unpleasant feeling.
meanings_and_examples.example: After receiving good news about her job promotion, she felt rid of all the stress.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In sports or games, to get a player out by achieving a specific goal.
meanings_and_examples.example: The basketball coach made it so that when someone caught the ball three times in a row, they had to be 'rid' of the court.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cause something or someone to disappear or become extinct.
meanings_and_examples.example: Overfishing has led to the riding out of several fish species from certain areas.
